Description: Glazed steatite bead inscribed with Egyptian hieroglyphs on both faces; rectangular shape with a curving upper surface and flattened sides; perforated longitudinally for suspension; both sets of hieroglyphic are set within incised borders: the upper surface gives the throne name of Ramsses II, below is the expression 'My Lord is enduring (for me)'; traces of brown-yellow glaze remain on the bead.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Uncertain tomb
Curator's comments: Hieroglyphic signs kindly identified by Marcel Maree (AES) in June 2009.
Bibliographic references: Joyner et al. 2006 / The materials of the Cypriote Bronze Age cylinder and stamp seals in the Department of Greek and Roman Antiquities, The British Museum, London. (p.137)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (no. 80)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 254)
SCE IV/1D / The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV. Part 1D. The Late Cypriot Bronze Age. Other arts and crafts (p. 654)
